result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Lou Spanyard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Judge reviews plea waiver with defendant signed by the defendant.  Def is 58 years old.

9:52 am   
Defendant Mary Lou Spanyard in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dismiss charges in 14CF145.  Thorie files an AMENDED INFORMATION - Def will plead guilty of 2 cts in the Amended Information.  Recommending:   S/W  probation 2 years   conditions: no contact with Leonard Keck, the landlord, no contact with W4232 370th Ave or 2336 Pierce/St Croix Rd, Baldwin     Restitution for a door - TBD within 30 days.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Court explains probation and possible revocation.  Def pleads guilty to Ct 1  of the AMENDED INFORMATION.  Atty Nelson stips to the facts in the complaint.  Def pleads guilty to Ct 2 of AMENDED INFORMATION.  Atty Nelson stips to the facts in the complaint.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates def guilty of Ct 1 and Ct 2 of the AMENDED INFORMATION.  Case 14CF145 is dismissed in its entirety.  Thorie: no contact has been waived by Rusty Weisender.  He is in the courtroom.  Atty Nelson makes sentencing argument.  Court addresses the defendant.  
COURT ORDERS:  S/W PROBATION 2 YEARS   CONCURRENT    CONDITIONS: COURT COSTS $243 PLUS $200 DNA SURCHARGE ON EACH CHARGE,  COMPLY WITH ANY CONDITIONS IMPOSED BY THE AGENT.  NO CONTACT WITH LEONARD KECK OR HIS ADDRESS (SEE ABOVE) OR THE PREMISES AT 2336 PIERCE/ST CROIX, BALDWIN,  RESTITUTION TBD WITHIN 30 DAYS - rest hearing may be asked for.    Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
Plea hearing on September 29, 2014 at 09:30 am.
filed by Wm Thorie

3:34 pm  
Defendant Mary Lou Spanyard in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Liesl E Nelson in the courtroom.  William H Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mary Spanyard in custody.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Ct Comm read the charges and max penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Atty Nelson is asking that the def's personal items be returned to her via escort by law enforcement.  She will be appointed a public defender. ADA Thorie will contact their VW Coordinator.  There will be no specific order regarding retrieval of her personal belongings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 03:45 pm.  Court orders $10,000.00 signature bond.
